channel.title: Jeonbuk on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Gochang green barley field festival - Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea
item.description:
Go

Gochang green barley field festival

Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

I was worried about the news of the rain all night, but the rain slowly faded away from the highway. I was in a hurry because I wanted to enjoy the morning scenery of the green barley field. The festival tastes good when it's too waxy, but I still wanted to go back to the green barley field. When I had the chance, I wanted to see the fog that covered the barley field and the sun rising through the fog.
At 7 am, thick clouds still fill the sky. Perhaps the view of fog and sunrise is wrong. Still, I'm excited by the smell of dark grass that reaches my nose. After the rain, we go to the green barley field following the thicker spring scent.
Green Barley Overcame Harsh Winter
Barley has grown to his knees. Isaac began to form a peregrine golgol also had a pretty shape. Barley, who has sprouted in the winter and endured the bitter cold, looks like a hunched young man after puberty. There is no fear of the world, 20s dressed in blood.
Blue barley refers to young barley
That is why the barley of April is called Cheongbo. Blue barley does not refer to the species of barley. Regardless of species, all young barley will be cheongbo. Even if the race and skin color are different, all young people are called youth.
Blue barley refers to young barley
Gochang Green Barley Field Festival, Pioneer of Landscape Agriculture
Gochang Cheong Barley Field Festival, which marks its 14th anniversary this year, is one of the representative festivals of Korea. The large-scale farmland producing 400 tons of barley per year, combined with the outstanding landscape, has become the new model of our country, the so-called 'landscape agriculture'.
Rape flowers are another star of the Gochang Blue Barley Field Festival.
You can see the green barley field spread over 3.3 million ㎡ along the hill. It is also fascinating to see it swinging back and forth in the wind.
Blue barley and rape blossoms are unique.
To get a feel for the green barley field, you have to walk. If you slowly walk along the landscape of blue barley and rapeseed flowers, you can feel the spring in the barley that stands in the wind, and the rape blossoms with alluring fragrance.
Blue barley and rape blossoms are unique.
If you have difficulty walking, sit on the pavilions all over the barley field and rest. Close your eyes in the sperm. The sound of the wind and the scent of flowers can be felt better by closing your eyes. If you feel like it, you can sing a barley field.
Mulberry in the movie Welcome to Dongmakgol
Green Barley Field through Storytelling
Also interesting are the themed spaces where you can walk along green barley fields such as goblin forest, tiger king field, and koi pond.
Bamboo shoots that meet in Goblin Forest resemble antlers
The Goblin Forest tells the story that the villagers who couldn't stand the Dobbi's tyranny drove the Goblin into the Great Forest, and bowed the temple to prevent it from coming out again.
The statue of King Sacheon built at the Baekmin Memorial Hall
You can see Ui Jong-gak who belled whenever a ghost appears. Behind the ghost forest, the Sichuan King statue made of stone can be found at the entrance of Baekmin Memorial. The Sichuan King's statue is located in the Baekmin Memorial Hall because the temple was built to contain ghosts.
Jong-gak who belled every time a goblin appeared
The tiger king's field, opposite the ghost forest, is where the tiger hides from the nasty mischief. How grumpy would the ghost hide in the field? A scared tiger model with a scared look at the entrance of the field is funny or sad.
Tiger model met at the entrance
At this festival, this space was created as 'themed roads with stories' so that visitors can find out the stories related to the roads. Follow the paintings on the floor of the promenade and it is interesting to see the story of goblins in the green barley field.
A themed road with a story that depicts a goblin story
Abundant food and sight seeing memories reminiscent of barley
Boats on the barley field walk are filled with barley rice. It is literally delicacy that you can eat fermented rice with fern, lettuce, bean sprouts and mix it with red pepper paste. If you put a strong bachelor kimchi here, there is nothing to be desired.
Barley dog rice cake is a food that brings memories of middle and middle aged people.
There are also barley sprout bibimbap and buckwheat jelly and buckwheat noodles in spring school. Like barley-themed festivities, there are many foods that use barley.
Barley rice cake that is delicious to see
Barley dog rice cakes, which are absolutely supported by the elderly, and barley rice cakes, are considered to be the memories of the days when they were hungry. Barley coffee contains 7: 3 ratio of beans and barley. The aftertaste is better than the average coffee because of this golden ratio.
Not barley tea, barley coffee!
Sweet and sour barley, crispy barley sprout cookies and soft barley fermented bread are ready to sniper children's taste. You can also make and bake barley dog cake directly at the driving site across the green barley field.
Barley fermented bread captivates children's tastes
There is also a farm artifact relic located at the entrance of the festival. Various traditional farming equipment such as threshing machine and mantle, which are rarely seen now, are exhibited, and it is also a place where stories can be heard starting from "when I am young". It is also familiar to the village elders who weaved as supporters of the event in the spacious hall inside the pavilion weaving stupid horses and nets. At Barrett Valley, you can make barley buds with barley buds and barley flutes.
Old men weaving straw in agricultural artifact exhibition
Time travel to Bronze Age, Gochang Dolmen Museum
The theme of this year's Gochang Cheongbori Field Festival is' Gochang, the Korean hometown, loved by Gobo. What does it mean that Korean native is Gochang? Perhaps I'm talking about Gochang's dolmen. Although dolmens are found all over the world, the only ones listed on UNESCO World Heritage sites are the remains of Gochang, Hwasun and Ganghwa. Among them, the largest dolmens are distributed in Gochang area, and the number is over 2,000. Only 447 dolmens are listed as UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Gochang.
Exhibits at Gochang Dolmen Museum
The Gochang Indol Museum is a 30-minute drive from the academy farm where the Gochang Green Barley Field Festival is held. In the hands-on learning room on the third floor of the museum, you can experience making fires, painting petroglyphs, and making dolmens. The photo zone, which reproduces the inside of the round zip at a full size, is also impressive. The open-air exhibition room is decorated with a prehistoric village that shows the life of prehistoric people and an experience yard where you can carry cover stones of dolmens that are modeled. If you use the dolmen train, you can meet real dolmens.
Tiled (Southern) Dolmen in Gochang Dolmen Ruins
Travel info

Gochang Green Barley Field Festival
-Address: 158-6, Hakwon Farmjang-gil, Gongeum-myeon, Gochang-gun, Jeollabuk-do
Inquiries: 063-564-9897 (Gochang Cheong Barley Field Festival Committee)

http://chungbori.gochang.go.kr/index.gochang

-Yonggung Sashimi Restaurant: Jukkumi Teppanyaki / 542-1, Shipo-ro, Jinam-gu, Sangmyeon

item.title: Gochang Book Village Harry - Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea
item.description:
Wolbong Village Book Village Harry Bridge

Gochang Book Village Harry

Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

The school where the children left was lonely for a long time. In the ten years since the school has been awakened, a dense “book forest” has entered and people have come back. In this school, reopened as a book village, numerous stories of “writing together” are written on paper. It's our ordinary but precious story.
Reborn school
Gochang Wolbong Village where you can hear the sound of waves in the distance and see the detailed movement of stars. In 1933, an elementary school entered this small town. A small building was built and children's friendly fauna were found throughout the campus. Many students grew up dreaming in this small course. But in time, Naseong Elementary School closed in 2001.
Transformed from a closed school to a book village
Lee Dae-gun, the village chief of the book town Harry, who had been a publisher in Seoul, thought he had to wake up the sleepy school he had set up. In 2006, he started to build a ruined school with the dream of building a book village. In 2012, he settled with his family.
Autumn mood complete campus
“There are many book towns in Europe. It's a place of tradition with old books. Book Village Harry wants to be a place where you can combine your thoughts, life and stories into one volume. It's a town where you become an author, a real publisher, and a dream come true in a book. ”
Autumn mood complete campus
The squeaky corridor was rebuilt, the classroom neatly refurbished, and the pictures were painted on the walls. Then I put in a book
The dog, Harry's family, “Harry.”
Book Village Harry was born, and Wolbong Village, where more than 20 households lived, rose to life.
Old building
I don't know much about it, but my grandfather, a farming doctor, and my grandmother, a child-raising player, have released their stories, and it remains a precious record.
Onnuri books warehouse with lots of books
Book and noni space
Book village has also entered full autumn. Ivy vines covered with red bricks add to the flavor of the season. Book Village Harry has 120,000 books. Books donated by stations, publishers, libraries, and individuals.
Book Village Harry's Main Space, Book Forest Time Forest
The book forest of book forest time, where books are stacked from the ceiling to the floor, is a heavy time. There is a strange cross between the wooden rafter that is exposed and the books that have been piled up together. Next to the book forest is the Hanji Studio where you can make paper.
Book Village Harry's Main Space, Book Forest Time Forest
When you enter a small house made of paper in the middle of the studio, the soft air is wrapped. There are a few young trees growing beyond the studio windows. There is also a typography in the next classroom. It looks old, but it still works.
Giant letterpress
The “Bulled Snow Library”, which consists of two classrooms, is full of tens of thousands of picture books and children's and youth books. Interesting things happen in the Nuri Book Studio, where people plan books, write, and draw.
Friendly wooden corridor
It is a space full of children drawing their hips on the floor and drawing with their children's passion to learn more.
Dorando is a book-sharing space, willow library
Head to the place where you can hear the roar of chickens.
Library with old blackboards intact
On a full moon Friday, a small festival is held here. The Owls and Small Full Moon Festival is a time to share a fun book story late at night by setting a topic every month. You can spend a romantic time playing music with a recital.
The open air stage where winds blow directly from the West Sea
Book Village Harry's unique space is by far the book book prison. It is a welcome place for those who cannot read a book properly due to lack of time or lack of concentration. When you enter here, you have to read books, but there are a growing number of volunteers!
Oddly, book jails are growing
Book Village Harry has 'flowering minbak' and 'byeolheun minbak', so it's good to stay overnight.
Oddly, book jails are growing
Create a book impregnated with thoughts
Book Village Harry doesn't just read books, he works hard to make things. Participation in the publication camp program makes it easy for anyone to create a book. Well-preserved tidal-flats and wetlands around the book village, dolmens listed on the World Heritage Site
In addition to the travel record, you can also write a book with family events to celebrate, and interview your parents.
Children who make books with the five-stable stabilization method
“When I write an introduction, I ask you to write something like a tombstone that looks back on your life. If you think about what kind of title, what kind of company you're going to go to, you have a specific dream. ”
Yoon Dong-Ho, Experience Team Manager
All the experiences related to books, such as planning, writing, editing, and binding in the traditional way, are packed with people. It is a family of seven book villages, including editor Lee Dae-gun and director Lee Young-nam, including Lee Yuk-nam's painter, Yoon Dong-ho and Kim Min-kyung.
Kim Jong-ja's smile makes her first book
Everything around me and me can be made into books. As we make books, we unleash a lot of thought. In other words, he is meaningful enough to be a book and a library.
President Lee Dae Gun and Lee Young Nam, who established the book town Harry

“I want to be able to write together beyond reading together in the book town Harry. The book slogan, “Everyone's Books, Everyone's Library,” means that everyone can relate to personal thoughts. It's difficult to write alone, so it's 'together', so it's not difficult. ”

President Lee Dae-gun is special in capturing the stories of ordinary people and carrying out the history of books that have been around for a long time.

Book Village Harry Family
Travel info

Book Village Harry
Address: 88, Wolbongseongsan-gil, Haeri-myeon, Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk
Contact: 070-4175-0914

item.title: Muju, where have you been? - Muju-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea
item.description:
Muju Bandiland

Muju, where have you been?

Muju-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

In winter, mountaineers who want to enjoy snowy country from skiers become paralyzed. However, Muju is a good trip even for those who do not have eye contact. This is because there are various places to see and eat that were not thought. I am meeting the charm of Muju hidden for you who are curious about the unique appearance of Muju outside of Deogyusan.
Here instead of Fabre insects, Bandiland
Fireflies light up tail lights only in clean areas. Muju is the place that has the most signals to indicate that it is clear water, clean air, and unpolluted land. Why is it that Bandiland is located in Muju?
Bondiland is a place where you can see various insects in your eyes. This is a customized, hands-on learning space for children. In addition to the largest insect museum in Korea, where you can meet rare insects in a large space of more than 120,000㎡, there are various facilities such as youth camping ground, natural recreation forest facility, firefly natural school, and astronomical science museum.
Muju Bandiland
The main experience center here is the Insect Museum. From the entrance, various insect models approach the children's curiosity and awaken adult's conscience.
Insect world is also amazing for adults
At the entrance of the museum, a model of a firefly, representing Muju, keeps its center cool. The main entrance to the main exhibition hall, which is located in the basement, is mysterious, creating an atmosphere that enters the cave with typical fauna and flora fossils from the Paleozoic to the New Saengdae.
Firefly model perched at the entrance
As its name suggests, it is full of insects from Muju, the world's first insects in Korea. Even for those who are not friendly with insects, this is a curious paradise.
Children looking closely at the butterfly model
There are various exhibits from the birth of the earth through insects, the story of dinosaurs from the past, and the realistic and mysterious evolution of vertebrates. In addition, the 3D stereoscopic video room and the dome screen video room where you can lie down to watch the world of insects are fun.
Children focusing on their exhibits
Meet the soul of Taekwondo, Taekwondowon
Taekwondo, representing Korea. The sacred place of Taekwondo is right in Muju. Muju Taekwondowon, the only specialty Taekwondo space in Korea and abroad, is half the size of Yeouido. It is a dream place for the world's taekwondo people who have everything about taekwondo, including not only museums but also international games, experiences, training, education, and research.
Taekwondo Museum where you can learn about Taekwondo
Everything from the spirit of Taekwondo to the fields of technology and the history of the development of Taekwondo can be seen at the National Taekwondo Museum. From the military martial arts of ancient Korean nationalism to the folk martial arts of the Joseon Dynasty, and to the present, the history of Taekwondo is melted in a three-dimensional exhibition space. In addition, Yap! Is a hands-on experience hall where you can experience the T1 performance hall where you can see your skills and skills. There is a `` challenge for challenge '', so visitors can go one step closer to Taekwondo.
Robot Taekwon V visits Taekwondo Museum
If you have plenty of time, take a look around Taekwondowon. If you take the shuttle bus in front of the challenge field, you can see Taekwondowon with a friendly announcement.
Monorail to the observatory
For the taekwondo people's training, they arrive at the entrance of the observatory through the traditional garden, Hoyeonjeong, after a leap where the accommodation and fitness facilities are arranged.
Nicely made gazebo
You can use a monorail or hiking trail to the observation deck. The view of Taekwondowon, which is in harmony with the surrounding mountains, from the panoramic observation deck is also an attractive point.
From the observation deck on the third floor, you can enjoy the scenery of Muju.
Gourmet vanity only steamed! 'White Island Geumgang Freshwater'
There is a restaurant that you only want to know. “White Island Geumgang Freshwater” is such a place for old regulars. But a good restaurant is rumored someday no matter how hidden. There is a visitor who misses this place from Chungcheong area near to Seoul from far away. Also, after the visitor writer Heo Young-man visited the house, he became more famous as a restaurant restaurant.
Pagasari Spicy Bath
The menu that makes this place famous is eoju porridge and pagasari spice soup. Depending on which vegetables and seasonings are used, the main taste is different, so it is not the right answer. However, every year, the deep taste of the three-time beats, including the sincerity of drying the radish finely, the deep hand taste from the soaked intestine, and the fresh flesh of the fresh fish, are stimulated by the tip of the tongue.
Unusual sujebi in Maeuntang
Another secret that this house is famous for is the sincerity of the health of its guests. Make all the side dishes yourself and do not use any seasonings. Boil the broth with 3 years old camphor ginseng from Geumsan, Chungnam. In addition, the use of persimmon tree, also known as rumors and medicinal trees, as a broth material is good for bones.
Ginseng is made with every effort to make ginseng
Let's plan a Muju trip for a healthy body and mind on the last weekend of January. Exciting trips for children and exciting trips for adults.
Deep-fried freshwater prawns with taste and price
Travel info

item.title: Gochang Up and Down Farm, Rustic Enjoyment with Honest Food - Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea
item.description:
Farm Hall with Farmers Market and Exhibition Hall

Gochang Up and Down Farm, Rustic Enjoyment with Honest Food

Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

Different forms of happiness are pursued by people, but the essence is the same. Breathe in the fresh air, eat innocent food, and keep your mind and body healthy. Occasionally, if you feel that little happiness far away, go to Gochang, North Jeolla Province. There is an up and down farm where there is a workshop where you can see healthy food made with reliable ingredients, food production process and various experience programs.
'Build, Play, Eat', The Values of Up and Down Farms
The word well-being that has come in and out of us. It is now a powerful motto that cannot be separated from our lives. It means that people's attention is focused on purifying the body and pursuing peace of mind beyond eating well and living well. The most responsive to these changes is the food market. Super farms such as lentil beans and aronia are popular as well as simple farm meals.
Foods for sale at farmers market
The reason for the existence of Gochang Up and Down Farm is in line with the above flow. It opened in April with the intention of informing the importance of food. The slogan of 'build, play, eat' was also suggested as 'a place where everyone enjoys together by making honest and right food'. Sangha Farm is now attracting the attention of family travelers as it has become an experiential healing healing destination that leads the future of Korean rural areas.
Milk cube bread produced in-house
When you enter the farm through the ticket office, you will first notice the environment designed according to the natural order. Not long after its opening, some buildings are still under construction, but if you look at what has been built so far, you can see that nothing has been built. In particular, the man-made swale (dented terrain) is impressive. Called a rainwater garden, the swale prevents bad phenomena, such as flooding caused by artificial pavement of dirt, and helps the garden to be more effective by using the time the rainwater has stayed. If a rainwater garden plays a role in returning rainwater to nature, there is a place where rainwater is collected like a reservoir. The stored rainwater is purified and recycled into toilet water, which saves both water and money. As soon as you pass through the ticket office, the large garden is not only a task of beauty. It is not only a space for the viewer to feel intuition and leisure in entering the countryside, but also functions as a device to show the proper food production process. Today, only cabbage and a few kinds of herbs are ready to be harvested, but until recently it was said to have been a green field full of green barley.
Garden with harvested traces
Make sausages, feed veal milk, and enjoy popular programs
The structure of the upper and lower farms is simpler than you think. It is a workshop that produces foods honestly with ingredients given by nature, stores where you can buy homemade foods, restaurants where you can eat healthy meals, experience classes where you can make ice cream or sausages, and various animals. There are five major categories, including animal farms that can communicate with each other. Among them, the experience class is required to make a reservation in advance, which is the usual order of making a phone call two to three days in advance and making a payment on the spot.
Experience Class B Building with Sausage Experience
There are four types of food experience: sausage, cookies, blueberry crumble cake, and glutinous rice cake. The time required is 40 to 50 minutes, but sausages and crumble cakes require additional processing time such as smoking and baking. You don't have to sit back and wait. You can freely visit the farm and return to the station to get your ticket.
Sausage making process: take the sausage ingredients
Prices range from 10,000 won to 15,000 won per person. You can make a reservation only in an even number because the ingredients are provided for one set of two servings. Adults can enter as a child's assistant for free, so please ask in advance for permission.
Sausage making process: Sprinkle starch, water, etc. on the minced meat
The most popular thing to try is the sausage making. On the weekends with crowds, the class is held three times a day in the classroom B.
The process of making sausages: knead by hand
One day before the experience, the farmers grind pork and prepare the ground, so participants can simply add the starch flour, parsley and water and knead the meat once again into the sheep casing.
Sausage making process: put meat in the filling body
The training is undertaken by the farm. If you wait 30 minutes, you can pick up delicious casings that are juicy and fill your mouth every time you bite the casing.
Sausage making process: inject the contents into the sheep casing
Because the process of putting kneaded meat in both casings is surprisingly difficult, parents with children under 8 years of age should opt for a milk bread or ice cream experience.
Sausage making process: makes a shape
Even if it is not a paid experience program, you can watch the sausage, bread, fruit and vegetables produced over the glass wall of the studio and keep in mind the importance of safe food.
Bread is made in the bread shop
There is also a way to go inside, but since the operation time of the studio changes according to the order quantity, the time to open the tour road is not known. At that time, it is best to go to the open workshop and check the situation yourself.
Cows spending leisure time at animal farm
You can't miss the experience of feeding hay or milk to the animals. You can feed the animals under the caretaker's care by visiting the animal farms in advance on the website.
Papillon goat dreaming of escape
The calf is fed milk every hour on an organic ranch just behind the animal farm and is always fresh and warm.
Gentle personality that doesn't get angry when you touch the horns
The calf eats the milk as if they know it, but this is a bit aggressive and the children are surprised.
A sheep couple having a quiet conversation with their eyes
If you miss the feeding experience, don't be disappointed.
Calf waiting for milk
Cute piglets and goats roam freely around the farm, so you can approach them and hand them over.
Calf Eating Storm
Favorite local food of all ages
When the experience is over, we recommend you stop by the farm restaurant for a meal. The top and bottom set meal is a cauldron of Shindongjin rice and stir-fried chicken with 4 kinds of side dishes and 1 kind of soup.
Relaxing scenery of the plantation restaurant
You can take assorted cabbages, lettuce, trout truffles, onion pickles, donkey leaf pickles, and ssamjang at the self-table. On this day, uncooked egg stew, plain and savory soybean paste, and delicious miso soup were the first to be sure.
Delicious top and bottom set meal
The advantage of a farm restaurant is to transparently disclose the ingredients and cooking process. The origin of all ingredients is domestic and most of them are grown and grown in Gochang, including 9-minute sea bream and fresh meat delivered by farmers, side dishes made with seasonal ingredients, and long-lasting miso. Anyone can see through the open kitchen how these ingredients become a dish.
Self table at the side of the restaurant
Seeing various vegetables, such as chicory, red lettuce, and kale, grown in a glass greenhouse on the second floor, doubles your faith and attachment to food. Some of the crops grown in glass greenhouses and open-air gardens are also used as food ingredients for farm-style restaurants and Western-style kitchens.
Hearty wraps with vegetables
If you are planning an experiential trip with young children, take note. The Sangha Farm is adjacent to the old Sipo Port and is suitable as a one-day course to look around the farm and the sea. The parking lot is large, and the restaurant and restroom are equipped with baby chairs, diaper changing tables, and small toilet seat covers for children. If you need to travel long distances to Seoul or Gyeonggi-do, stay at Farmers Village, a farm accommodation facility. Opened in 2017, the facilities are clean.
Nong
Travel info

Sangha Farm
-Address: 11-23 Sangha Nongwon-gil, Sang-myeon, Gochang-gun, Jeollabuk-do
-Hours: 09:30 ~ 21:00 / Open year round
Inquiries: 1522-3698

http://www.sanghafarm.co.kr/


week
-Sperm Tree Sashimi Restaurant: Sashimi, Tzugumi / 135, Gusipo Beach-gil, Sangmyeon
-Daeeun Hall: Korean, shellfish cuisine / Dongsan 7-gil, Gochang-eup, Gochang-gun, Jeollabuk-do / 063-564-3304


Rooms
-Gochang virgin farmers Bed and Breakfast: 100, Wolbongseongsan-gil, Haeri-myeon, Gochang-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea / 010-5430-7684

http://claudia_1004.blog.me/220137728187

item.title: Gimje, Jeonbuk, Korea - Gimje Arirang Literary Village
item.description:
A panoramic view of Arirang Literary Village Public Relations Hall

Gimje Arirang Literary Village

Gimje, Jeonbuk, Korea

'Ginger blind gang other emmit'. 'Jinge' means 'Gimje', 'Meng Gang' means Mangyeong, and 'Oemit' means lazy people. It is the old saying of Gimje Mangyeong Plain, Korea's representative granary. The wicked horde of Japanese colonial beasts have been spreading the land since the early 1900s. To send military beauty to the battlefield to fill their ambitions. The novelist Jo Jung-rae wrote in Arirang the history of suffering and resistance that the minchos had to face in this process.
Meet the years of raging in the novel Arirang
Why is the title of the novel Arirang? Arirang is a song that our people shared with us when we were happy or sad. The background of the novel is from the pre-Korean merger to liberation, when Arirang's ringing is the loudest. Let's take a look at the audience watching Na Un Kyu's movie Arirang in Arirang. "Kim Young-jin is being dragged by the Japanese police and the melody of" Arirang "that the band plays begins. Arirang Arirang Aririo .... When the chorus was just over, "to the independence of Korea!" It was a man's cry. "To the independence of Korea!" The novelist Cho Jung-rae said that he easily wrote the title Arirang. This may be because there is no title as appropriate as Arirang.
The novel Arirang
Arirang Literature Village reproduces the stage of the novel Arirang in reality, revealing the painful days without filtration. Since the story of Arirang begins in Juksan-myeon, Gimje-si, it has been built around the old inner village and Oori village, so travelers can experience living literature. Arirang Literary Village is largely composed of public relations hall, Harbin station, Naechon and Oeri village, and modern seizure agency. The PR Hall is itself a friendly guide to Arirang.
PR Hall 1F
Although Arirang is a best-selling book, many of them have been burdened with reading because it is a 12-volume novel. The first floor of the PR building filled the walls with text about Arirang. The plot of the flow of the novel, the portrayal of the characters and the relationship of the main characters, and the excerpts of the core anecdotes in the novel are organized in a structure. Just look around slowly and read easily to find out what Arirang is.
PR Hall 2F Letter Sculpture
On the 2nd floor of the PR Hall, there are descriptions of independent militants from Kim Je. Unfamiliar heroes protested against Japan for fear of death. The devastation of an unjust age would have led to their consequences. Independence troops rushing with guns symbolically represent this.
Independence Army Statue
Harbin Station and Seolwoon Village, a village that recreates the best scenes of modern history
Harbin Station in Arirang Literary Village is a 60% reduction of Harbin Station in China in the 1910s.
State of Harbin Station
Combining the historical background of Harbin and Arirang, there is an incident that comes to mind quickly. According to Harbin Ahn (1909). When you go out through the waiting room in the area, the best scenes of modern history are realistically expressed in statues. When Ahn Jung-geun pulls the trigger, a bullet carrying the nation's core penetrates the heart of the empire. Ito Hirobumi was shortly after getting off the train, so steam locomotives also appeared in those days.
Harbin's scene of Ahn Jung-geun
Harbin Station itself is a two-story exhibition hall related to Arirang, just like a publicity hall.
Harbin station 2nd floor comfort women statue
There is an immigrant house in front of Harbin station square. Reproduced the house and the reed house built by people who went to other country because of the Japanese colonial exploitation. At least you and your house are likely to play a role, but the reeds are too poor. In Arirang, a reed hut appears. "People who gathered a bunch of reeds began to make huts. The huts were to dig the ground into man's height and cover the roof with reeds on it."
Immigrant houses
Naechon and Oeori villages were made by reproducing houses such as Son Pan-seok, Jisam-chul, Gamgol-d's house, and Song-in-ri.
Hand-painted houses
It is a village that has idyllic ambience with neighboring thatched houses with small backs. But the landlords' lives described in the novel are not as peaceful as the town's exterior.
View of Naechon Village
Son Pan-Suk works as a liaison to the medical and independent forces and suffers a lot. Ji-chul is retaliated by the pro-Japanese Jang Chi-ilmun for his misdeeds. Gamgol is suffering from debt because his eldest son is sold to Hawaii because of debt, and his two daughters are humiliated by Japanese minions. When my eldest daughter says she's going to a concubine because of poverty, she says, "We must starve together and die together." Anyone who knows the sad story of a peaceful town can't control his feelings.
Art work near town
Modern exploitation agency built by evil in Japan
The modern exploitation agency is the place where the pain of Arirang is best conveyed. It is composed of a cotton office, a representative office (the agency where the Japanese colonial rule was employed), a post office, and a rice mill.
Modern collection agency street
The municipal office is the leading organization in the exploitation of land. Baek Jong-du, a pro-Japanese leader appointed to Juksan-myeon in Arirang, opposes the peasants by forming a landlord commissioner (a vanguard that pursues the land inspection project of the governor general). It is a land survey project, but it is a trick to take away the land of Joseon by attaching a secret bad clause. In the Juksan-myeon Office, there are telescopes, compasses, cameras, abacus, and lighters. It is obvious that it was used as a tool for evil.
Exhibition office
Is there another place as scary as the Japanese colonial rule? As soon as you enter the shelter, the sound of the sound comes out, creating an eerie feeling. "The military police made the same sound every time they wielded. It wasn't what they wanted to answer. It was a beat to save my deity in the medium, and a spirit to cheer me up." There are all kinds of torture tools, such as a whip. Inside the barbed window, the sad eyes of the imprisoned prisoners are expressed in murals, accusing the cruelty of Japan.
Picture of the wall inside the iron bars of the detention center
The post office was nothing more than a Japanese-language intelligence agency, and the mill was the only place for rice for the Japanese.
Post Office Front View
The woman's scream is heard in the mill. It's the sound of a female employee who was so hungry that she burst into the wind while stealing a little bit of rice. We need to steal rice from our land… The lives of the lost folks are cruel.
Interior view of the mill
Travel info

Arirang Literary Village
-Address: 180 Hwacho-ro, Juksan-myeon, Gimje-si, Jeonbuk
Contact: 063-540-2927, 063-540-2929


Restaurants near

-Scent of Life: Hansiksik / 190-14 Wonpyeong 1-gil, Geumsan-myeon / 063-543-2325

https://sh55.modoo.at/

-Unam Maeuntang: Maeuntang / 220, Dongseo-ro, Gimje-si / 063-542-0431


Rooms
-Moaksan Youth Hostel: 460-20 Moak-ro, Geumsan-myeon / 063-548-4401

http://www.moakyh.co.kr/

-Star Palace Motel: Hajeong 1-gil 9 / 063-547-1005

item.title: Sunchang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea - Put red pepper paste, beat rice cake, make rice, and experience Jangchang
item.description:
Sunchang Paste Experience Center

Put red pepper paste, beat rice cake, make rice, and experience Jangchang

Sunchang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

'Jang Jang Sunchang' is Sunchang's slogan. This is a good expression of Sunchang, famous for gochujang. If you go to Sunchang Gochujang, gochujang is Sunchang. I made a traditional Jangjang paste of Sunchang, cooked foods made with soy sauce, and made a hands-on experience program to make healthy snacks. The children are very funny and even eat delicious. It is an experience where even adults grow happy.
Spicy rice cake pizza dough ~
10 am Saturday. As soon as you arrive at Sunchang Jangjang Experience Hall, you will be busy. The Jangjang experience program will take about 2 hours, including gochujang making, gochujang cooking, and seasoning of rice cakes and tofu.
Gochujang Bulgogi Pizza Making Experience
To make an effective time arrangement, we first cooked the Jangjang, then make the Injeolmi and Tumbap outside, and finally, make Gochujang. Today's dish is made from gochujang pizza with gochujang bulgogi. In addition to Gochujang Bulgogi Pizza, you can choose from Kimchi, Gochujang Spaghetti, Cheonggukjang-jjigae, Cheese Tteokbokki, Gochujang Namul Gimbap, etc. What's interesting is that instead of pizza dough, cut the rice cake into thin pans like rice cake for rice cake soup. All you need to do is pour the dough on top so that the rice cakes don't fall and stick together. Place bulgogi seasoned with red pepper paste on top of rice cake dough and sprinkle chopped vegetables with topping. Sprinkle plenty of cheese on top and decorate with ketchup. Switch on the pan with the lid on and wait for it to finish.
Gochujang Bulgogi Pizza Making Experience
Close your ears and say "Yeah ~"
While the pizza is ripe, go outside to make Injeolmi and rice. Injeolmi is the key to rice cake making. At first, adults have to take turns to crush rice grains. Tteokme is more fun and less difficult to stand and beat each other by hitting each other.
Injeolmi making experience
When the rice is crushed in moderation, change it to children's rice cake and give it to the children. Like a funny play, the children wait anxiously for their turn. After hitting three or four times, the sound of rice cakes is getting louder and louder. The black hot frying machine is turned gently to increase the pressure. The children are squeezed the handles so that they can see them once, but I'm excited to know what's coming out. Finally, I'm going to explode. The children close their ears tightly and look at the machine. "뻥 ~!" White steam is rising with a loud noise. The children rushed in when they put rice rice in a large basket. Fill your hands with greed and bury your face. It is fried quickly and its taste is very delicious. Children eat more rice than any snack.
Tempura making experience
In the meantime, Injeolmi is completed and soaked with soy flour. Child who slices rice cake, child who gets soybean powder, experience that is behind the scenes and busy to eat… . They enjoy making and eating in different ways. Injeolmi is a good combination of soybean flour mixed with chewy rice cakes. I made it and ate it right away, so the cuts of rice and the rice are delicious. It is not a taste of memories, but a taste that surpasses memories.
Tempura making experience
Taste pizza and make gochujang
After the outdoor experience, go back into the experience room. A well baked pizza is waiting. Thanks to the red pepper paste on the dough made with rice cakes, the pizza is perfect for the taste of Koreans. Gochujang seasoning is a bit spicy, but it is eaten instantly. After the pizza tasting, the highlight of the day is the red pepper paste making experience.
Gochujang making experience
First, listen to why Sunchang Gochujang is delicious and how to make it. In other regions, square meju is used to make soy sauce, soybean paste, and red pepper paste. What is unusual is that the meju is usually picked in early winter, but Sunchang makes meju at the end of August. When the weather is hot, the microorganisms that add the rich flavor of red pepper paste multiply well. Another special feature of Sunchang is that it is not only made from soybeans but also mixed with rice at 6: 4 ratio. Soybean paste is soaked in winter and aged for more than 6 months.
Gochujang making experience
After listening to the explanation, take a moment to make a gochujang quiz. The experience is surprisingly simple. Distribute bowls of mew flour, red pepper powder, Sikhye, salt, and malt in the right proportions by team. The secret is to mix them well so that they don't clump together. Mix it up and dip it with your finger to taste it. It's a strange taste. Gochujang is not made right away because it needs to be aged. As time goes by, our traditional Jangjang, which tastes deeper, is truly slow food. If you leave the gochujang made by the visitors in the experience hall, they will gather them together and mix them well. Instead of making it on-site, you will receive a well-cooked gochujang one by one.
Gochujang making experience
Gochujang Village to preserve the traditional taste
After enjoying the Jangju experience, take a look around Gochujang Village. In Kochujang Village, Kochujang can be produced and sold only if you are recognized as a master of Kochujang. The merchandise in the market is almost reliable. All you see here is the red pepper paste shop, so it's as if you're in the red pepper paste country. Gochujang Nara is not a small Gochujang village, but it is enough to catch our taste.
Sunchang Red Pepper Village
In the yard, there are many jars of red pepper paste, miso and soy sauce, and the pickles smell like pol-pol in the store. Jangjang is good, but rice thief pickles are just as popular. There are many kinds of pickles such as plums, radishes, cucumbers, garlic seeds, sweet persimmons, sesame leaves, deodeok, scallops, oysters, etc. You can taste and choose different kinds of pickles.
Sunchang Red Pepper Village
There is also a rice wine jar next to it. The pickles that are eaten in the mouth are salty, but when you taste them after sipping the rice wine, "kya" sound comes out. Cheonggukjang smells very little and tastes so mild that children eat well. The steps are so great when you pick up pickles in a hot pepper paste made by a master.
Sunchang Red Pepper Village
I have tried making jang but I do not make delicious jang. How much effort do you compare to the workmanship of a master who has been in the market forever?
Sunchang Red Pepper Village
Travel info

Sunchang Paste Experience Center
-Address: 55, Folk Village-gil, Sunchang-eup, Sunchang-gun, Jeollabuk-do
-Experience program: Make Soonchang Traditional Red Pepper Paste, Make Korean Cuisine, Make Injeol, Make Traditional Tofu
-When using the experience program, you can use the accommodation facilities in the experience hall.

http://www.janghada.com/


※ The above information was updated in March 2017 and may change afterwards, so please check before you travel.

item.title: Gunsan, Jeonbuk, Korea - Gunsan Sinsi-do, a place to catch saltwater fish
item.description:
Experiencers enjoying the opening under the rising sun

Gunsan Sinsi-do, a place to catch saltwater fish

Gunsan, Jeonbuk, Korea

The place where we could meet 90 minutes by boat from Gunsan Port came to us with a fantastic drive course and superb view. I have met Shinsi-do, a place with beautiful and secluded island scenery and exciting fun.
Gogunsan-gun is a must-see
The road that has no end, the sea and the vast sea that surrounds it are mysterious. Saemangeum room, where we changed the map of South Korea in April 2010
Lovers enjoying a date at Saemangeum Seawall
zero
Road to Wolyeongjae behind Saemangeum Service Area
In the middle of the embankment is Shinsido, which is designated as the Knoll Island among the four-color autumn themed islands selected by the Ministry of Tourism and the Korea Tourism Organization.
Yellow ribbon to indicate winding
In Sinsido, people began to live in the early days of Silla due to the herring of herring around the island. Gogunsan-gun, with its beautiful scenery called “star in the lake,” is the largest of the 24 islands. I would like to stop for a while and leave a picture if I am running along a cool road along the embankment. That's why it's nice to see a rest area or an observatory. One of the most famous is the Saemangeum Rest Area, which is located at the highest 199 peak (199 m above sea level) in Sinsi-do. Opposite is a monument to the construction of the Saemangeum Seawall.
Monument to build Saemangeum Seawall opposite the Saemangeum Rest Area
It is not so difficult to see the landscape of Gogunsan-gun at the rest area. Behind the parking lot of the rest area, there is a way up to Wolyeongjae which is a 7 course of Gunsan winding road. It is an alley connecting Sinsi-do and the embankment, and it can be said to be the starting point for the realization of Gogunsan-gun. As you climb the slope, you will find a crossroad between 199 and Wolyeongbong. Wolyeongbong is composed of columnar joints that can be enjoyed in Jeju Island.
Superb view of Gogunsan archipelago from 199bong
If you want to capture both the Gogunsan-gun and Saemangeum embankments, head to 199. The hiking trail that climbs to the 199 mountain peak is less intimidating than it might be due to the appearance of the Gogunsan archipelago.
Saemangeum dike seen downhill from the summit
199 peaks so arrived. Gogunsan-gun, facing Haemu, is a masterpiece drawn by nature enough to paralyze the nerves of the whole body. I want to sit down and watch the sunset, but it's hard to come down when it's dark.
Middle-aged couple sitting side by side and looking at Gogunsan-gun
The finishing strokes, opening of Nol Island
When it is said to go in and experience, the people who change their boots to go to the mud flats quickly and easily. This is because it is a perfect moment for you to feel the taste of fish thicker than your forearm. It is the site of the “opening experience”, which is the No. 1 public trust that made the new city a “nole island”.
A child holding her mother's hand and looking over the mud flat
Opening is the traditional fishing way to catch fish. At low tide, the pine pilings are semi-oval on the mud flats, and the bottom of the net is buried along the pilings on the bottom of the mud flats. At high tide, we sailed out of the boat, hung the top of the net on the pine stakes, and spread the net.
State of children enjoying Gaemagi
The expectation that fishing is difficult due to the muddy water is missed nicely. If the water depth gets shallower, the mullet, which is over 50cm long, will appear, but it is more appropriate to say that it is difficult to catch it with great force. Feel for the first time in life
State of children enjoying Gaemagi
Experience is not possible every day, so make a reservation after checking the date by phone or through the website. It's a fishing method using tea, so you can experience it around the corner. Also, don't be late for experience. You should start on time to enjoy longer.
Gray Mullet
The Sinsido Fishing Village offers free boot rental for an easy opening experience. However, the fish scales are slippery, so preparing a paddock is essential. It's a good idea to get extra clothes because you may get wet in the sea or you might fall off a mud flat.
Large amount of fish caught enough to prepare icebox
Travel info

New Sidor Village Village
Address: 83-7 Sinsido-gil, Okdo-myeon, Gunsan-si, Jeollabuk-do
Contact / Reservation: 063-463-7088

http://vill.seantour.com/Vill/Main.aspx?fvno=3707


1. Nearby restaurants

item.title: Frozen, Naesosa Temple in the White Snow
item.description:
Dawn of Goat Salt Dishes

Frozen, Naesosa Temple in the White Snow

Buan-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

This Byeonsan Winter Travel Course is prepared with 'Naesosa-Gear Sosa Salt Paste', which binds inner and outer mountains at once. Not to mention the millennium consideration Nae Sosa, Gomso woven in one course, and decided to take a look at the salt pant. Gomyeojeon, which has been famous for a long time, in the West Sea, I will not be involved in the salting technique developed to eat abundant seafood for a long time. The winter Gomyeojeonjeon is a vivid landscape filled with ice snow glittering like salt instead of salt. If you add the quarry river and red river, the outland mountain is perfect for winter sea travel.

A trip to the West Sea, where you can see everything at sunrise and sunset, becomes even more abundant in winter. Is it thanks to the seasonal foods? Is it the power of white snow? One winter, during the heavy snowfall of the West Coast, I visited Buan Byeonsan Peninsula, the pearl of the West Sea. I missed the winter landscape of the Naesosa fir forest road and the arid seasons of the Reddish River and the Quarry River.

Buan Byeonsan Peninsula, Pearl of the West Sea
It's a winter torsion. A salt field, salted out as it is. Snowy salt fields resembling white salt are more serene and beautiful than you might think.
Salt storage for salt
In addition, if the day is clear, you can see the sunrise at Gomso Port.
Before dawn
The Saemangeum Public Relations Hall is the first to greet you when you enter Buan along Saemangeum Road.
Red wall named for proud scenery
Go up National Route 30 and look around the coast of Byeonsan Peninsula (outside Mt.) and go to Gomso Port or follow the Inner Mt.
The appearance changes depending on the water
Knowing when to bite makes it easier to make copper wires. Because quarrying and reddish rivers are different depending on the time of lifting.
Gyeokpo Beach seen from the top of the chicken

In other words, if it is time for water to fall into the quarry and red water rivers at the time of arrival, you can walk to Naesosa Temple or Gomso Port first. You can check the time at the Byeonsan Peninsula National Park website.

http://byeonsan.knps.or.kr/front/portal/visit/visitCourseMain.do?parkId=121800&menuNo=7020091

Gyeokpo Port, viewed from the top of Chicken Ebon (85m)
When the arrival time is high, stop by the Red Rock and Quarry River first. After eating, go up to Euibong Peak (85m) and look at Byeonsanji vegetation and Gappo Port at a glance.
Evening Gappo Beach with heavy snowfall
Then take National Route 30 and go counterclockwise to reach Gomso Port.
Road to Chicken Ebon (85m)
Wait here! Before you reach Gomso Port, remember the Jeonbuk Student Maritime Training Center located between Evergreen Beach and Mohang Beach. You can enjoy the wonderful fall falling into the sea against the backdrop of Sol Island.
Sol Island Sunset in front of Jeonbuk Student Maritime Training Center
If you want to shoot a good sunset, you should arrive and wait 30 minutes before sunset. If the time is not right, you can see Gomyeojeonjeon or Naesosa first.
Buan Bear Fire Hydrant Sunset
The reporter looked for Naso Sosa in anticipation of seeing the sunrise at Gomso Port. Naesosa is famous for cherry blossoms in spring and colored leaves in autumn. The winter scenery in the white snow does not fall out. If you find it right after the snow piled up would have encountered a more spectacular scenery.
Gappohang Sunset
A Millennial Consideration Meets the Fir Forest Path
According to records such as Dongguk Yeoji Seungram, Naesosa's original name was 'Sorae-sa (蘇 來 寺)'. It has been said that it was named “Naso” because the Chinese Tang Dynasty Chang-Sang Jeong-bang was established. After one week, the path leads to Cheonwangmun and a fir forest path that introduces Nao Sosa Temple, which is more than a thousand years old.
Naesosa
It's about 500m. If you reach the Cheonwangmun through the fir forest that is likely to lead to the Winter Kingdom, it is welcoming to Nasosa. Daewoong Preservation (Treasure No. 291), which appears to be brilliant, almost disappeared. There is a lack of testimonial data and it is preserved as it is without coloring. Along with Seonggyesa Temple, Silsangsa Temple and Changrimsa Temple, it was selected as the 4th largest temple in Byeonsan. Only Naesosa keeps its place for many years.
Seolseon-dang and Yosa reach through one order of Naesosa Temple
The flower pattern grate, which has been dull for the past year, is also eye-catching. At sunset, you can see the shadows of the flower-patterned grate with the red sun. Here is not the end. If you find Naesosa, let's go inside Daewoong Bojeon. There is a statue of White Kannon Bodhisattva on the wall behind the Buddhist altar. If you make an eye upon your eyes, your wish will come true.
Flower pattern grate of Naesosa Temple Daewoong Preservation
Yeongsanhoe Gwanbultang (Treasure No. 1268), Goryeo Dynasty (Treasure No. 277), and a legal book (Treasure No. 278) are also treasures of Naesosa. Due to the large number of external exhibitions, it is rare to be in Naesosa Temple.
Daewoong Preservation of Naesosa Temple
King's beloved salt, resurrected in the modern day salt-bearing salt

After exiting Naesosa, climb National Route 30 and you will soon reach Gomso. Gomso has been famous for salt pans since ancient times. Gyehwabeol was the main production area, but during World War II, it became a land by constructing roads and building dikes linking the interlocking villages with Hodo (Bumseom), Ungyeon Island, and Sokdo during the end of the Japanese War. As such, the 45 hectares of Gomin-so-jeon are located in Gomso Port. The annual salt production boasts 2500 tons. Let's take a quick look at the signboard at the beginning of Gom Gomin.

Gomso's specialty is salt. In the past, salt was so important that it was managed by the state and must not have been sold until recently. One of the things to take to the king's refuge was salt. While man is necessary to live… (syncopation)… The production of salt in Buan was mainly flame, and the area of Gyehwa Daeverly was the main production area. Gomso's good salt taste makes fermented foods such as Gomso Salted Fish, Soybean Soybean Paste, and Cinnamic Bamboo Salt, a specialty.

Gomyeojeon, which has been famous for many years

Gomson solar salt is produced from March to the end of October. You can get salt every summer and every 3 to 5 days in spring and autumn. Summer salt is large in crystals and small in crystals but hard in autumn. Gommon sun salt has little bitter taste because it is not used when the concentration of liver water becomes dark.

I found Gomso salt field before dawn. The snow is still piled up due to the heavy snow on the west coast, which has not yet wakened up from the dark. It is not cloudy and the sun does not appear. Instead, I could see the Gomyeojeonjeon waking up. Slowly dark goes Instead of salt, the snowflake sits on top of the salt pan and shines. Except for the winter, you can also enjoy the Gomyeo salt preservation experience.

Gomyeojeon, which has been famous for many years
Travel info
